section.title: Introduction
section.p: The basic goal of the outsourcing is to create the following tools given the linguistic resources developed by the Divvun project team, and in cooperation with the team.

tr.td: Adobe InDesign 2 and newer, primarily for MacOS X 10.3 and newer, but optionally also for Windows 2000 and newer

ul.li: hyphenator (sme)

tr.td: Microsoft Office 2000 and newer (running on Windows 2000 and newer)

ul.li: speller (sme, smj)
hyphenator (sme)

tr.td: Microsoft Office 2004 and newer (running on MacOS X 10.3 and newer)

ul.li: speller (sme, smj)
hyphenator (sme)

section.title: Adobe InDesign
section.p: The Divvun project will outsource the integration of a sme hyphenator, and possibly the whole making of the hyphenator. In the latter case, the Divvun project will provide the language-specific algorithm, and of course be responsible for testing the linguistic correctness of the deliverable.
section.note: We need to contact the most important users, and check which version they are using or will be using. There's no use in requiring the contractor to test against an older version than needed, it will only add costs to the project. The same goes for the OS version and platform required.
section.p: The exact list of deliverables is:

ul.li: one set of binary hyphenation file(s) for hyphenation of North Sámi according to the hyphenation rules of North Sámi, using the hyphenation API found in InDesign 2/CS/CS2 and all versions thereafter released before October 1st, 2007.
installation application to provide end users with a simple and automatized process of correctly installing the binary file(s)
user documentation in English and Nordic languages as far as readily available by the provider
user documentation in North Sámi, and possibly in other Nordic languages if not readily available from the provider, based upon translations provided by the Divvun team

section.p: The assumption behind the first user documentation point is that the providers have similar or identical existing products, and thus existing user documentation to be translated. Any existing user documentation will be reviewed before being accepted. If no user documentation exists, it will have to be created from scratch.

section.title: Microsoft Office
section.p: The Divvun project will outsource the making and the integration of the proofing tools for MS Office, based on the computational linguistic models developed by the project.

section.title: For MS Windows
section.p: The exact list of deliverables for MS Windows is:

ul.li: one set of binary file(s) to provide North Sámi spelling correction using the CSAPI version 3 in MS Office 2000, MS Office XP and all MS Office versions released before October 1st, 2007, running on MS Windows 2000 (all versions), MS Windows XP (all versions) and MS Windows Vista (all versions).

one set of binary file(s) to provide North Sámi hyphenation using the CHAPI version 3 in MS Office 2000, MS Office XP and all MS Office versions released before October 1st, 2007, running on MS Windows 2000 (all versions), MS Windows XP (all versions) and MS Windows Vista (all versions).

one set of binary file(s) to provide Lule Sámi spelling correction using the CSAPI version 3 in MS Office 2000, MS Office XP and all MS Office versions released before October 1st, 2007, running on MS Windows 2000 (all versions), MS Windows XP (all versions) and MS Windows Vista (all versions).
installation application to provide end users with a simple and automatized process of correctly installing the binary file(s) listed above
user documentation in English and Nordic languages as far as readily available by the provider
user documentation in North and Lule Sámi, and possibly in other Nordic languages if not readily available from the provider, based upon translations provided by the Divvun team

section.p: The assumption behind the first user documentation point is that the providers have similar or identical existing products, and thus existing user documentation to be translated. Any existing user documentation will be reviewed before being accepted. If no user documentation exists, it will have to be created from scratch.
